column4: DANG, Ubuntu, with dual screen support is a MILLION times better than windows
with ULTRAMON!
deskspace flip with compiz etc
VERY useful
hehe, multiple desktops has always been a great feature in linux, with ot without multiple monitors
I am loving it TONS :) I flip the desktop and 2 more desktops
yeah, much more monitor wall friendly =)
and the restricted drivers actually worked with ease this time :)
At work I run my workstation with 2 nvidia pci-e cards and 4 19" lcd
I bet that is nice :)
can you recommend any HD benchmarking tools for linux?
oh hell, I was jsut doing that last week while playing with my new sata card, one sec
yeah hdparm, also there is bonie or somethin like that
have top running in another terminal and you can watch the load
I googled it, bonnie++ was the thing I was thinking of also. http://linux.com/feature/139742
thanks
bittornado works, I use torrentflux on my server though
I will check out those others
I used transmission on the mac and did not like it much, Torrentflus is great as I tell it to download on my home server, then shut my laptop and go to work
torrentflux looks neat :)
on my home server I run samba fore filesharing, torrentflux for downloading, firefly for itunes sharing, next is something for xbox 360 video sharing
a linux based solution for the 360?
not quite, stock 360 but to be able to view my video files shared from my linux server as though it were a media center
ushare is the tool I've read a bit about for it - http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=632428
